reviews.title: zoom doesn’t work when opening app on iPad

reviews.author: disappointed %$@%

reviews.title: Nobody asked for this
reviews.text: Please give an option to eliminate the AI summaries.  Would rather read reporting from real people
reviews.author: timjbuck

reviews.title: Article stopped loading and app became very slow
reviews.text: After a recent update, articles stopped loading. It takes several app relaunches to load an article. If I want to read more than one article, I need to restart the app constantly. Overall, the app got very slow and unbearable to use. If both issues aren't fixedb soon, I may need to request a refund for my subscription, as I can't read the news I pay for.
reviews.author: t9ux5n1b

reviews.title: The surrender of the WSJ
reviews.text:
The Wall Street Journal was once the gold standard of American business journalism. Today, it reads like a parody of its former self. Facts have given way to partisan talking points, with coverage increasingly indistinguishable from Democratic Party messaging and the fashionable dogmas of socialist, secular elites. Editorial honor is gone. Rigor is gone. In its place are shallow, unverified hit pieces aimed not at informing readers, but at harming Trump, Religious, children and scolding the country that built it.

I say this with real sadness. I have read this paper for nearly forty years, and watching its steady abandonment of intellectual honesty, economic literacy, and even basic respect for its readers has been painful. What was once a mighty institution now seems content to trade credibility for applause from people who would have mocked it a generation ago. The Wall Street Journal didn’t lose the battle —it surrendered.   (Maybe it is the Neville Chamberlain of papers)
reviews.author: Business Men Buy Papers

reviews.title: 5 stars
reviews.text: I don't understand how anyone gives this app five stars it continually crashes and has to be restarted.
reviews.author: * Patricio *

reviews.title: 40$ a month
reviews.text: Why would anyone pay $40 a month for the news in the age of technology. Most I’d pay is 10$
reviews.author: Anonymous199375

reviews.title: Why no comments?
reviews.text: Obviously this is a very good newspaper, and I enjoy reading it. However, the app would be greatly improved by also allowing me to see the comments left by other readers on the article.
reviews.author: jgsihdkxkhckgsidkhzir

reviews.title: Mark your one year
reviews.text: If you don’t cancel your subscription, they will charge 43$ per month. A real shame.
reviews.author: Proppppp

reviews.title: Great content, but drains battery
reviews.text: I find the content and writing is top-notch, the app UI is intuitive and easy to use, catering to those who prefer both blog style with most recent news appearing at top as well as broadsheet like the print edition. Another plus: the ads are low-key unlike other news apps. Starting a few months ago though I’ve noticed the WSJ app seriously drains my battery. I’d give it 5 stars if it wasn’t so power-hungry.
reviews.author: JohnnyBravo77

reviews.title: A 200-Year-Old Paper With a 2-Month-Old App
reviews.text: Running the WSJ app on an iPhone 17 Pro Max feels like beta-testing a two-month-old startup, not using a product from a nearly 200-year-old institution. Perhaps the app team could take a few notes from Johanna Stern and set “basic performance” as a New Year’s resolution for 2026.
reviews.author: NeoTX35

reviews.title: Where are the comments?
reviews.text: Excellent app and some of the only real journalism left out there. Would give 5 stars easily if the comments below articles were not missing.
reviews.author: missMyAndroidSoMuch

reviews.title: Just Add WSJ.com to Home Screen Instead
reviews.text:
The app eats my battery like no other app and makes my phone hot. The scrolling seems to be pretty jumpy and unpredictable lately.

I’ve ended up adding the WSJ.com webpage to my Home Screen and having it “Open as a web app”. Boom, problems solved!
reviews.author: CougarGrad

reviews.title: Wsj app make my phone HOT!
reviews.text:
iPhone 15 Pro running iOS 18.7.  Phone immediately heats up when using the WSJ app….. no other app causes this.  WSJ app can easily consume 30% of my battery with just a single casual reading session.       
**** Update Oct 4,’25. After the recent WSJ app update (14.50.0) 34197 it seems like the high battery consumption and burning hot phone has been improved…..WSJ still consumes a lot of battery but less than before….App still hangs periodically then just gets itself “unstuck”
**** Update Oct 7 ‘25.  I am now on iOS 18.7.1. App is now worse than ever…. Hangs frequently and now I have to force close the app.  There are now also video based Ads that cannot be paused.
****Update Oct 20, 2025.. Updated to 14.51.0 with no improvement.

**Update Nov 15 ‘25. Big backslide with the 14.53.0 release! My phone gets really warm again and WsJ is again consuming tons of battery. Has used 21% of my battery in about 20 minutes of reading

*** Update Dec 20 ‘25. Now at iOS 26.2 and WSJ 14.56.00…. Phone gets hotter than ever! WSJ seemed to have fixed the hot battery issue only to break it again….

WSJ….. turn off this auto-play garbage!! 

WSJ Developer…. It would be nice if your release notes told users what was fixed rather than “…. Fixed minor issues”.

It seems that no one is reading or responding to feedback on the app here. I’m going to try reaching out to the editors via email…. Someone at WSJ needs to know how awful the app is and how upset customers are.
reviews.author: Disappointed S40 user

reviews.title: STOP the Auto-Play Videos and Ads!
reviews.text:
PLEASE provide an ability to stop auto-playing videos in the app (which I access mainly from an iPad). It is annoying and distracting. I pull up an article to READ it - not to be assaulted by a barrage of audio and video. 

Same for the auto-playing video ads. They are tacky and make the app look and feel like a third world bazaar. 

Navigation remains clunky, with some navigation at bottom of page and some at top. No other app I’ve seen uses this mixed method of navigation

There is a lot of “jerkiness”, especially looking at sections of articles, where the list spontaneously moves up or down for unknown reasons (I suspect it’s ads or surveillance of users). The app also crashes frequently. 

All in all, the app is very weak and frustrating. I find myself enjoying the content, but cursing the app, every time I bring up the WSJ on my iPad
reviews.author: NJ Guitarist

reviews.title: Trash
reviews.text: If you want to read more on an. Article you need to pay up homie lol
reviews.author: Eduardo82000

reviews.title: Great newspaper, terrible app
reviews.text: I love the WSJ paper. But the app is terrible. I want a newspaper, not videos. I certainly don’t want autoplaying videos every time I open the app. And either there’s no way to turn them off or the setting is hidden in a way that makes it impossible to find.
reviews.author: RW_DC

reviews.title: Glitchy and constantly fails
reviews.text: When reading headlines, the app jumps around constantly. Compared to every other news app I use, this one is notoriously glitchy. Often I open it and it just freezes. Disappointing given this is the content I want.
reviews.author: DillMcGill

reviews.title: Great reporting, bad app
reviews.text:
I really love the news reporting here, but the app’s performance has been a major hurdle, especially after the recent update. There are several critical UX issues:

- Scroll Instability: The story list jumps randomly while scrolling, which is incredibly frustrating.

- Audio/Video Conflict: While listening to audio transcripts, the jumping scroll often triggers a video auto-play. This mutes the current audio - a significant issue while driving.

- Syncing Issues: Bookmarking is unreliable. The "Bookmarked" tab often displays incorrect stories or fails to update unless I restart the app or toggle tabs. Bookmarking/unbookmarking actions often don't work.

- Stability: The app crashes sometimes.

I’d love to keep using this for my daily news, but the technical execution needs serious attention to be usable.
reviews.author: lucas676

reviews.title: Ugh! - where is today’s WsJ
reviews.text:
Can’t share via iMessage anymore.  I can’t take all the video!  Let me turn it off.  If it’s worth watching I will.


Super glitchy…. When is today’s edition going to drop.   This app gets worse with each release.  Turn off all the video.  If I wan to watch, I will.  If I wanted a video news channel, I would have the WSJ.





After many months of this new app version, and repeated updates, it continues to be an inferior experience to the prior version.

For each item an update attempts to address, another feature or functionality is broken or lost.  When are we going to have the ability to read the print version while offline again?  When will I be able to load the current print version without having to launch the app, close and launch again (often 3 or 4 times), waiting for 20 or 30 seconds each time to see if it will work?

The developer response to the overwhelming frustration with the version launched last summer and the persistent promises of improvement suggest no one on the development team is capable of creating and improving this horrible product.  This app should have been kept in development until you figured out how to make it work.
reviews.author: Blkfish71

reviews.title: Doesn’t open anymore
reviews.text:
The digital version on the WSJ used to be a pleasure to use. The months long “improvement” process has resulted in significant slowing of the app as well as bizarre relocations of search functions back and forth across the page. Now, it simply won’t work. I have deleted and reinstalled the app but it remains nonfunctional. Fortunately, I still have the traditional newspaper. Addendum: so the app now works again but still has very frustrating features. For example, when it opens, it displays the previous day’s edition, not the current one. Second, it remains very slow to open page 1 (tho possibly not AS slow as it was). Articles are opening more consistently-previously, you could try to open an article and it would just freeze-that seems better. Fact remains, what was a smooth running, reliable and pleasurable experience has been significantly degraded. They keep talking about “improving” the product but if they were serious, they would go back to square one.

Addendum:
They’re at it again, fiddling with the app and making it extremely frustrating to use-it freezes, cuts out and slows to a crawl. After reboots, shut downs and restarts it reverts to the older version of the app which works flawlessly. You think there’s a lesson in that? Very disappointing.
reviews.author: jcm43md

reviews.title: Too Many Notifications!
reviews.text: Can we please control what type of notifications we get? I want breaking news. I have no interest in some random article. I read the whole thing almost daily. I don’t need encouragement.
reviews.author: Thandrol

reviews.title: Ads in a paid sub
reviews.text: You gotta be kidding me. I pay a subscription and you add ads!
reviews.author: mpls55412

reviews.title: Jittery scrolling!
reviews.text: This app jitters when scrolling and then the phone heats up. Annoying to use the app. The New York Times app behaves properly. I gave 3 stars because the reporting and writing are excellent.
reviews.author: Murray130

reviews.title: Gets stuck scrolling
reviews.text: App worked fine before but now it gets stuck while scrolling, difficult to read articles without the app hanging and sometimes needing to be reset. Need to fix this bug!

reviews.title: Buggy App
reviews.text: I like the WSJ, but the app needs some work. When I open the app, it takes a while to update the latest news. I have to sit there staring at the old news until it finally reloads. It will also glitch while I’m scrolling through the main feed, where it suddenly shifts way down. Then it takes me a while to go back and find the article I was going to click on.
reviews.author: Brett_123

reviews.title: It used to seem more balanced
reviews.text: Sadly, Media is a uniparty now and that includes the WSJ.
reviews.author: musoyui

reviews.title: Missing two key features
reviews.text: Doesn’t integrate with iOS and Google well. Opening stories in Google News and elsewhere should allow me to open the story in the app where I’m logged in. And I really miss audio speed control. Please allow us to set playback speed!
reviews.author: p7345

reviews.title: Uses too much storage
reviews.text:
This app is 
 flawed for several reasons that the developers should be able to fix: 1. The app runs hot and drains the battery more than any other app on my iPhone. 2. The app uses 2GB+ of storage even when there are no saved articles — and there is no way to clear the cache (the only way to remedy the issue is to delete the app periodically). 3. Every time you navigate to another app (e.g. Safari), the WSJ reloads and you lose the article you’re reading and where you are in the article. This last one is especially egregious because Apple has a standard way for applications to be coded to “hold their place” when you navigate to another iOS app. For reference, I have plenty of storage and memory on my iPhone and this problem only occurs with the WSJ app.
reviews.author: GEO444NE

reviews.title: App crashes on every use
reviews.text: What a happened to app stability?? It not hangs or crashes on every use!
reviews.author: BeatHappy

reviews.title: SLOW Please fix backend!
reviews.text:
The newspaper is great! But the app is the most inefficient, slow, computationally hungry app on the App Store! 

Please work on your backend, the ui is fine. It makes the app unusable and drains battery quickly.

It is just pulling text from the internet so I don't understand why this app is suddenly now so slow.  Obviously it is doing some sync or whatever but it still doesn't excuse this - none of the other apps that are very intense have this issue.

reviews.title: Stop the videos
reviews.text: I find the embedded videos to be distracting and have been unable to turn them off. If I wanted to watch the news, I would turn on the TV. I read the Wall Street Journal because I don’t want to turn on the TV.
reviews.author: Chip Oidos

reviews.title: Good content; awful app
reviews.text:
Three things. 
One, the app freezes whenever I scroll. I suspect it’s because it’s loading as content or videos. 
Two , give me an option to prevent videos from autoplaying. I don’t want to watch your videos; I want to read the articles. This isn’t some Buzzfeed and I’m not a child. Don’t treat me like one. 
Three, push notifications for breaking news also send feature article notifications. These are categorizing separately in notifications settings but not distinguished in execution.
reviews.author: Dee Awr

reviews.title: Going the wrong way
reviews.text:
Navigation that plays hide and seek. Videos that want to play, but don’t start at the beginning when you tap unmute. And lowbrow ads, despite me accepting all cookies and clicking on the good ones. This is not curated. 
I accept that I’m a bit old-school, but this is not beauty in the objective sense of the word. I downloaded this app in 2011. It’s not ascending. 
I love the reporting, but this app keeps getting worse.
reviews.author: karlbruno

reviews.title: Freeze while scrolling
reviews.text: The app has been freezing up when scrolling down. It’s been going on for months and seems getting worse. Not having similar issues with other news apps

reviews.title: Update made my WSJ app more readable
reviews.text: Live the update, it is more readable and clean , the new fonts are great to read for long time. Also the way live updates shows up for markets and economics and stocks is nicely displayed in Home Screen. Great work WSJ.
reviews.author: Imharry4u

reviews.title: Glitchy for the Price

The app frequently glitches, doesn’t scroll and gets “stuck” on certain articles. Really not the sort of experience you would expect from a respectable news agency, especially not for the price that WSJ asks for.

It increasingly stalls after the first few screens even though I am the only user. All attempts to reach help or technical support are useless. They never return emails or calls. Good paper but awful app and service.

reviews.title: great journalism, bad app
reviews.text: I read the Print Edition every day in the app, and I have noticed a steady degradation of user experience. The large amount of embedded videos (some advertising, mostly WSJ content) autoplay and rapidly drain my iPad’s battery. Since there is no option to turn off autoplay, the only way to use the app for an extended period of time is with my wifi connection turned off. I don’t have the same issue with other apps (Economist, FT, books).

reviews.title: Hard to believe how bad this app is

3. I can scroll briefly then app is unresponsive

Seems to happen more severely if I haven’t opened the app in a while.

reviews.title: Crashing even after multiple updates

reviews.text: Way too many issues with this app lately. It hangs up constantly, freezing for 5-10 seconds, is killing my battery when using the app, and my phone is getting very hot when using the app. Clearly the app is loaded with bugs.

reviews.text: Our local library includes access to wsj digital. Before 14.52.0, everything worked great. After 14.52.0, the app goes to a login screen as soon as an article is selected. The wsj app works fine on android.

The app works, although there are some limits.

No ability to change text size as you want, it goes the same as phone settings. And no ability to increase audio speed
reviews.author: Xirlamaister

reviews.title: Laggy and slow
reviews.text:
Constantly hangs up while scrolling to read news stories and headlines.

 WSJ needs to focus on basic text journalism functionality (my main consumption format) before adding more video, which seems to massively degrade the entire experience.
reviews.author: William Zenker

reviews.title: Crashing
reviews.text: Love the Wall Street Journal. Hate the app. Crashed three times this morning trying to listen to an article. It’s unbelievable how much better than New York Times app is compared to the Wall Street Journal app. The functionality has improved over the years, but to still be crashing in 2025 is unacceptable.

reviews.title: Massively buggy
reviews.text: I have to restart this app at least once every time I open it. Good content and design, but your tech is ruining the experience.
reviews.author: Ceckel

reviews.title: Heats up my iPad and runs down the battery
reviews.text: The WSJ is indispensable, but after a half hour or so it heats up my iPad and drains the battery. I kill it, do something else—like write this review— for a while then get back to it and it’s fine again— for a while. I’ve had to do this for several months now. This app right now is anything BUT a “sticky” platform.
reviews.author: Fnelowet

reviews.title: Cool news, hot device
reviews.text: First rate content and usability, but nothing on my iPhone or iPad drains battery faster when open. Both become hot to the touch. Would be 5 stars if that was fixed.

reviews.title: WSJ App
reviews.text: Nice access to stories and markets, but lacks some features (article gifting and comments) found on the website.

reviews.text: My one big complaint is that the audio feature doesn’t work when the phone locks up. It doesn’t continue playing the way music, podcasts and the NYT app do.  It’s very annoying.

reviews.author: Stop asking for this plz

reviews.title: Slow buffering
reviews.text: I like the content, unfortunately, the apps performance after recent changes has degraded significantly. Scrolling becomes impossible for 10 - 20 seconds , rendering the app frustratingly unnavigable and slow( from time to time).
reviews.author: Alexandre123223
